makers.displaydate: 1915–1991; born Aberdeen, WA; died Provincetown, MA; active New York, NY, and Greenwich, CT
makers.displaymaker: Robert Motherwell, 1915–1991; born Aberdeen, WA; died Provincetown, MA; active New York, NY, and Greenwich, CT

texts.textentryhtml:
Untitled shows Motherwell incorporating material from his studio into his collages, as had been common in his work from the 1960s.  Throughout this period he confronted the lingering traumas of World War II and the mix of anxiety and ambition in postwar America. Seeing collage as a modern form of still life, he related tearing with killing and paintsoaked paper with bandages. Each element in a composition
served witness to past moments and places; the collage is a buildup of experience, a memorial to a state of events.

bibliography.boilertext: "Acquisitions of the Art Museum 1975," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University, 35, no. 1 (1976): p. 22-31.
